name: CashOutStatus
definition: classifier indicating the extent to which funds are released to the borrower on a new loan origination that refinances an existing loan
label: cash-out status
explanatoryNote: This is subject to lender and/or investor policy(s).

name: MortgageIndemnityGuarantee
label: mortgage indemnity guarantee
definition: insurance-backed guarantee that protects lenders if the mortgage repayments cease for some reason, perhaps due to death or a homeowner being made redundant at work

name: DwellingCapacity
label: dwelling capacity
definition: classifier indicating how many dwellings some property has

name: AmortizationType
label: amortization type
definition: classifier of amortization algorithms

name: MortgageLoanPurpose
definition: the purpose for which mortgage loan proceeds will be used, such as real property purchase, dwelling construction, or loan refinancing
label: mortgage loan purpose

name: MortgageIndemnityGuarantor
explanatoryNote: SME Review notes 16 Sept: Guaranty - mortgage insurance e.g. insure up to 80% exposure. When you get into indemnification, then for instance if the product doesn't meet the investor's requirement such that if it doesn't get paid then the lender steps in and takes the hit for the loan - this is usually a precondition for securitizing (issuing) the loan in a pool. If the loan is not going to be sold on the secondary market there would be no need to indemnify that loan so this term would not apply. Indemnification is insurance for the investor, while the lender is the one providing that indemnification.
label: mortgage indemnity guarantor
definition: guarantor and insurer that provides mortgage insurance in the form of a mortgage indemnity guarantee (MIG)

name: PropertyUsage
definition: a category indicating the manner in which the borrower intends to utilize the property
label: property usage

name: ManufacturedHomeLegalClassification
label: manufactured home legal classification
definition: category indicating whether the covered loan is secured by a manufactured home only or with land as well

name: ChargeCategory
definition: classifier indicating what a particular fee or other expense is for
label: charge category

name: NMLSR-ID
definition: the number permanently assigned by the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLS) for each company, branch, and individual that maintains a single account on NMLS.
label: Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry Identifier

name: MortgageIndemnityInsurancePolicy
definition: insurance policy providing the mortgage indemnity guarantee
label: mortgage indemnity insurance policy

name: AutomatedUnderwritingSystem
definition: software system that collects the information necessary to approve a loan application and supports a mortgage lender's analysis of a new loan application
label: automated underwriting system
explanatoryNote: In the United States, automated underwriting systems review the applicant's credit history and ability to repay the loan, and determine whether the price the applicant is offering to pay is supported by the property value.

name: hasOriginatingServiceProvider
label: has originating service provider
explanatoryNote: Typically this will be a bank, mortgage broker, investment bank, or other similar party.
definition: relates something, typically a loan contract, to the service provider responsible for originated the loan

name: DwellingCapacity-singleFamily
definition: 1-4 units
label: single family

name: CashOutStatus-NoCashOut
label: no cashout
definition: The mortgage is refinanced for less than or equal to what is owed.

name: ManufacturedHomeLegalClassification-realProperty
label: real property
definition: the covered loan is secured by a manufactured home and land

name: AmortizationType-growingEquity
definition: A graduated payment loan in which increases in a borrowers loan payments are used to accelerate reduction of principal on the mortgage
explanatoryNote: Due to increased payment, the borrower acquires equity more rapidly and retires the debt earlier.
label: growing equity

name: PropertyUsage-primaryResidence
definition: residence that the owner physically occupies and uses as his or her principal residence
label: primary residence

name: PropertyUsage-secondHome
definition: a property occupied by the owner for a portion of the year that is not the primary residence
label: second home

name: ChargeCategory-principal
definition: the principal of the loan that is owed
label: principal

name: hasNumberOfAffordableDwellingUnits
label: has number of affordable dwelling units
definition: relates real estate to the number of dwelling units it contains that are income-restricted under Federal, State, or local affordable housing programs.

name: ChargeCategory-originationFee
definition: a charge for an origination
label: origination fee

name: AutomatedUnderwritingSystem-DesktopUnderwriter
label: Desktop Underwriter
definition: an automated underwriting software system produced by Fannie Mae

name: AutomatedUnderwritingSystem-FHAScorecard
definition: an automated underwriting software system produced by Federal Housing Administration (FHA)
label: FHA Scorecard

name: hasNumberOfDwellingUnits
definition: relates real estate to the number of dwelling units it contains
label: has number of dwelling units

name: ManufacturedHomeLegalClassification-personalProperty
definition: the covered loan is secured by a manufactured home but not land
label: personal property

name: AutomatedUnderwritingSystem-GuaranteedUnderwritingSystem
definition: an automated underwriting software system used by the USDA rural development loan program
label: Guaranteed Underwriting System

name: ChargeCategory-appraisalFee
definition: a charge for an appraisal
label: appraisal fee

name: CashOutStatus-CashOut
definition: the mortgage is refinanced for more than is owed and the borrower pockets the difference.
label: cashout

name: AmortizationType-graduatedPayment
definition: a flexible payment loan where the payments increase for a specified period of time and then level off
label: graduated payment

name: AmortizationType-adjustableRate
definition: a loan that allows the lender to periodically adjust the interest rate in accordance with a specified index
label: adjustable rate

name: AutomatedUnderwritingSystem-LoanProspector
label: Loan Prospector
definition: an automated underwriting software system produced by Freddie Mac

name: CashOutStatus-LimitedCashOut
label: limited cashout
definition: a cashout mortgage where the amount is limited by the lenger. 80% loan to value ratio is a common limit.

name: AmortizationType-rateImprovement
definition: a type of flexible loan where the interest rate may decrease based on payment history.
label: rate improvement

name: AmortizationType-step
label: step
definition: a loan with fixed periodic payment/rate changes without subsidy or negative amortization.

name: ChargeCategory-discountPoints
label: discount points
definition: a charge for lowering your interest rate

name: AmortizationType-graduatedPaymentAdjustable
label: graduated payment adjustable
definition: a loan for which there are periodic payments/rate changes with additional specified principal and interest changes as documented in the Security Instruments.

name: AmortizationType-fixedRate
definition: a loan in which the interest rate and payments remain the same for the life of the loan
label: fixed rate

name: PropertyUsage-investment
definition: a home owned for the purpose of generating income
label: investment

name: assumes
definition: relates a new mortgage loan contract to a previous one made to a different borrower for the same property. The new contract is created via a legally binding process where the new borrower assumes the terms of the previous loan contract
label: assumes

name: hasOriginatorPerson
definition: relates something, typically a loan, to a person that initially originates or creates it
label: has originator person

name: DwellingCapacity-multiFamily
label: multi-family
definition: 5 or more units

name: ChargeCategory-lenderCredits
definition: a credit whereby the lender reduces closing costs in exchange for a higher interest rate.
label: lender credits
